definition: a violent throw, to eject the contents of the stomach through the mouth
details:
noun
- a violent throw
= synonyms: hurl
- the act of throwing a fishing line out over the water by means of a rod and reel
= synonyms: casting
- the act of throwing dice
= synonyms: roll
- object formed by a mold
= synonyms: casting
- bandage consisting of a firm covering (often made of plaster of Paris) that immobilizes broken bones while they heal
= synonyms: plaster cast, plaster bandage
- container into which liquid is poured to create a given shape when it hardens
= synonyms: mold, mould
- the visual appearance of something or someone
= example: the visual appearance of something or someone
= synonyms: shape
- the actors in a play
= synonyms: cast of characters, dramatis personae
- the distinctive form in which a thing is made
= example: the distinctive form in which a thing is made
= synonyms: mold, mould, stamp
verb
- to eject the contents of the stomach through the mouth
= synonyms: sick, vomit, purge, retch, cat, chuck, honk, puke, barf, vomit up, be sick, disgorge, regorge, spew, spue, upchuck, regurgitate, throw up
- to formulate in a particular style or language
= synonyms: put, frame, couch, redact
- to choose at random
= synonyms: draw
- to throw forcefully
= synonyms: hurl
- to get rid of
= example: to get rid of
= synonyms: throw
- to put or send forth
= synonyms: throw
- to form by pouring a substance, e.g. wax or hot metal into a mold
= example: to form by pouring a substance, e.g. wax or hot metal into a mold
= synonyms: mold, mould
- to select to play, sing, or dance in a performance
= example: to select to play, sing, or dance in a performance
- to move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
= synonyms: stray, vagabond, roll, tramp, ramble, swan, drift, range, wander, roam, rove
- to deposit
= example: to deposit
- to assign the roles of a movie or a play to actors
= example: to assign the roles of a movie or a play to actors
